website_summaries.verdict: The Linksys EA8500 Max-Stream AC2600 MU-MIMO Smart Wi-Fi Router uses the latest wireless technology to deliver speedy 5GHz throughput to multiple devices at the same time.
cons: Clients must support MU-MIMO to take advantage of enhanced performance
Advanced settings are difficult to find

website_summaries.verdict: The Linksys AC3200 Tri-Band Smart Wi-Fi Router delivers the fastest 5GHz throughput we've seen to date. It has a top-notch interface and can be managed via a Web interface or smartphone app, but that luxury doesn't come cheap.
cons: No LED indicators on front panel

customer_reviews.title: failed within 6 months of use.
customer_reviews.text: It was very difficult to get this up and running. Not compatible with VIRGIN MEDIA unless you put the Virgin Hub into Modem mode. the signal is good once working but there are black spots in larger properties / thick walls. During my 6 months use, i have had to restart, refresh and reset to default on more than 3 occasions. Eventually this product has failed and does not send signal out after 6 months. Amazon failed to support any refund / replacement and pass the buck back to Linksys to resolve. not really customer centric as suggested!
customer_reviews.author: M. Shah

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: Do not be put of by the price this router is great improved my wifi 10 fold.There is an app for andriod and ios what makes changing settings etc no hassle at all.10/10 i give this bit of kit tou do not need to be an IT engineer to set up.
customer_reviews.author: SQUATTING NEV

customer_reviews.title: Easy Peasy
customer_reviews.text: So easy to setup even your nan could do it. Much better than my ancient Apple router. A couple more Ethernet ports would have been nice but very happy with the WiFi performance.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Average router
customer_reviews.text: Greetings all, After 2 weeks of usage and a lot of network hangs, found that it's an average router suffers from a several issues mostly in port redirections and disconnection from network. It has a good UI and management application to the mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Description was not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The description specifies that the router has OpenVPN but it does not have OpenVPN. So beware.
customer_reviews.author: Adalsteinn Thorbergsson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Enables everyone to be on-line all over the house at the same time - gaming, streaming video etc.
customer_reviews.author: C G PARKER

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: really good wifi on this box i love the speed on my ps4 now
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: Good bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent piece of kit. I do take the point some reviewers made about already being connected to the internet to get started. I had no problem with this as I already had a previous, older, Linksys route, and connect to the internet via a Virgin Hub. I just use the Linksys router for its wi-fi reach. Which is excellent. I had problems with the old wi-fi router as it did not have 5G, and did not have 'one-touch' button connection for accessories like printers. Set up was quite straight forward, if taking a little time. Very pleased with the unit
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Warwick H. Holden

customer_reviews.title: Good Wired Connections, Disappointing Wireless Connections
customer_reviews.text: I'm not keen on the aesthetics of this model, but that's not really important. Setup out of the box was fairly simple and once it was hooked up I was able to link to the internet readily. As a wired router this is a good unit and delivered solid connections to the computer, TV and both gaming consoles and there was little evidence of lag when gaming online. Sadly the wireless signals are not are inspiring. Range is fairly weak and even with range extenders around the house wireless connections flickered between 1 and two bars with connections dropping randomly several times per hour.
customer_reviews.author: S. Porter

customer_reviews.title: but like many have said getting a strong signal is not ...
customer_reviews.text: The internet does feel a lot faster when you can get signal, but like many have said getting a strong signal is not guaranteed. We live in a fairly small flat with quite thin walls but for some reason the signal does not work well on the opposite side of the building. It's pretty surprising given the price of this router and makes it very difficult to seriously recommend for most people's needs.
customer_reviews.author: T.K.

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: • Upgraded from an older more basic Linksys router - there is an improvement with speed, but not that significant. • Useful in that it broadcasts at both 2.4GHz and 5GHz as I have some older units which don’t recognise 5GHz. However the 5GHz range isn’t as good as I was expecting. • Easy to set up although it is quite a large unit when sitting on a desk. • Expensive and I am not sure it is worth the premium price for the upgrade when my old router did the job just fine • Found the Linksys software speed test measures below what is really being achieved
customer_reviews.author: Funk

customer_reviews.title: Does What it Says
customer_reviews.text: The first thing you notice about this router is that it is quite large. This is on comparison to most modern routers which are a lot smaller. However, it more than makes up for it in performance and features. There os a lot packed into int. It was very easy tis et up and the WiFi was working quickly. The signal strength remained good with several devices working at once. There has been no noticeable drop off with use. The further reaches of the house are a little weaker but I have noticed this with most routers. This is not a huge problem and devices still work well.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Jones

customer_reviews.title: Features you can't use......yet
customer_reviews.text: Considering the high RRP i was expecting top notch performance with all the bells and whistles. Sadly whilst it was easy to setup i found the wifi range not as good as my Asus ac68u. It is also worth mentioning that the advertised speed of 2600 is only available with a suitable adapter and most tablets, phones and laptops will only achieve 450mbps and the mu-mimo is also not built in them either so Linksys really ought to include an adapter considering the RRP. Future proof yes but not worth upgrading for.
customer_reviews.author: Keats The Cat

customer_reviews.title: "For Cable connections and Fibre connections with openreach modem"
customer_reviews.text: Please be aware of the following although this is a router (not a modem and router) the box clearly states that it is only for use with "For Cable connections and Fibre connections with openreach modem" This wasn't clear on the product description and as it was a router not a modem something I wouldn't have looked out for to check. I don't have a fibre connection yet (but that is another story) or cable so I can't proceed further.
customer_reviews.author: artemisrhi

customer_reviews.title: Amazing - has transformed broadband service for us
customer_reviews.text: I have standard broadband through the Coop who require that i use their modem to provide support. The Linksys router has performed wonderfully. The 5 Ghz band supports all modern tech and while the signal is never strong it reaches further than my original wifi. The guest options are very useful when I have visitors. I have had no problem streaming video even when other usage is heavy. Easy setup - thoroughly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Darrin Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Doing the job
customer_reviews.text: The Linksys EA8500 Max Stream Dual Band router is easy to set up and linked to my computers and tablets with no problems at all. So far the most noticeable difference is if downloading or streaming movies everything goes at full speed. I haven't had any periods of slow internet since I've had it so, so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Little Mo

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded our Internet speed
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly fast router. Easy to setup and immediately increased speeds in our small business/office setting (about 10 devices) and the previous router was struggling... this one completely upgraded our Internet speed without changing anything else. Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Collins

customer_reviews.title: Linksys
customer_reviews.text: This is very expensive for what it is. My tech helper tells me it was simple to set up but it didn't look that way to me when I was watching. I have to admit am a technophobe though. In my opinion It didn't make much if an improvement to the router and modem I was already using.
customer_reviews.author: kehs

customer_reviews.title: Good Dual Band Router.
customer_reviews.text: This is another great router fro Linksys, which is ideal for anyone needing a powerful dual band, open VPN router. It offers superb streaming on wifi, and has Ethernet ports too, should you need them. Recommended for all...happy streaming :).
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for standard broadband systems
customer_reviews.text: I'd love to write a comprehensive review of this modem, but unfortunately the lack of vital information on the product description page has led to me not being able to use it. This router is not compatible with standard broadband; it is only compatible with "cable connections and fibre connections with openreach modem", according to the box. I am sadly still on regular broadband and so cannot make any use of this router, and can only suggest that you make sure it will suit your system before purchasing. (There is one other thing I can comment on: be aware that this router is quite large and unwieldy, and may well detract a little from your decor!)
customer_reviews.author: Miss

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: This is one to go in the NOT FOR SKY pile. I should have learned by now that when Mr MSU claims he can get that one to work, that in fact he can not. Cloning the sky password does not work and it all goes a bit pete tong. That said you can hook it up to the sky box and feed everything else through that and get bits to work faster but then you are using more electricity and we are trying to cut down. As a kind of switch box we have some success. This is very small and we are impressed with the design.
customer_reviews.author: I am probably a human

customer_reviews.title: Good router
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son to use in his flat. Reports are that it is quick and easy to set up. It achieves good speeds and is consistently reliable. It is a little on the large side but that's not a major problem. I good router.
customer_reviews.author: JuliaC

product_meta.title: Linksys EA8500-UK Max-Stream Dual Band 4 x 4 MU-MIMO AC2600 Smart Wi-Fi Router with USB 3.0, 4 x Gigabit Ethernet Ports, eSata Port, Black
product_meta.description:
THE LINKSYS MAX-STREAM AC2600 MU-MIMO GIGABIT WI-FI ROUTER (EA8500) OFFERS A SEAMLESS SOLUTION FOR MULTI-DEVICE HOUSEHOLDS WITH HIGH NETWORK TRAFFIC
The Linksys Max-Stream AC2600 MU-MIMO Gigabit Wi-Fi Router (EA8500) offers a seamless solution for multi-device households with high network traffic. Using the latest wireless-AC technology, Multi-User MIMO, this router delivers 4.6x faster Wi-Fi speeds so multiple users can stream movies, play online games, listen to music and more at the same time without interruption.

4x4 Wireless-AC technology delivers four data streams (rather than the two or three found on standard routers) with speeds of up to 2.53 Gbps. Additionally, four Gigabit Ethernet ports, a USB 3.0 port and an eSATA/USB 2.0 port provide high-speed data transmission for wired connections and storage devices.



BOX CONTAINS
Linksys AC2600 Dual Band 4x4 MU-MIMO Router (EA8500)
Quick start guide
Four detachable antennas
Ethernet cable
UK power adapter
CD-ROM with documentation
feature_bullets: Breakthrough Multi-User MIMO (MU-MIMO) technology enables 3x faster Wi-Fi* for the whole household
Multiple users can enjoy simultaneous lag-free video streaming, online gaming, and mobile viewing
4x4 Wireless-AC delivers 4 streams of data for stronger, faster performance when gaming and streaming.
Beamforming technology optimizes performance and reduces interference by focusing wireless signal to connected devices.
Linksys Smart Wi-Fi lets you remotely monitor and control network

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars53 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
